meanings.sent1: The fishermen were skilled reelers, pulling in their catch with ease.
meanings.sent2: She watched the reelers at the fishing competition, admiring their technique.
meanings.sent3: The reelers at the dance party spun around so fast, they looked like spinning tops.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the reelers of the fishing club were portrayed as heroes of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The reelers in the story were known for their ability to bring in the biggest fish.

meanings.definition: A device for winding or unwinding something.
meanings.sent1: The old reelers in the attic were used to wind up the thread for sewing.
meanings.sent2: He used the reelers to unwind the hose and water the garden.
meanings.sent3: The reelers in the workshop were so rusty, they squeaked when turned.
meanings.sent4: The reelers in the factory spun so fast, it was like watching a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The reelers in the garage were neatly organized, ready for any task.

meanings.sent1: The traditional reelers at the festival danced with joy and energy.
meanings.sent2: She learned the steps of the reelers dance and performed it at the recital.
meanings.sent3: The reelers at the ballroom event twirled gracefully under the sparkling lights.
meanings.sent4: The reelers on stage moved in perfect harmony, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The reelers in the dance class practiced diligently to master the routine.
